DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if the TEAM prevention intervention delivered by a physician and an HIV-positive counselor is effective. It is hypothesized that those who receive the intervention will report a higher reduction in risky sex than those who were in the standard-care condition.
DOC.brief_title: Project TEAM: Teaching HIV Prevention in the HIV Clinic
DOC.criteria: 1) 18 years or older, 2) HIVinfected, 3) Sexually active, 3)Receiving HIV primary care at participating clinic, 4) Can communicate in English or Spanish, 5) No previous enrollment in the TEAM study or intervention. 1) Participation in a similar study run by the TEAM PI.
